description.raw:
Add two new functions get_attributes and set_attributes, for getting and setting attributes with the automatic JSON serialisation/deserialisation on arbitrary HDF5 groups, not just device groups. This is basically just exposing the same functionality as t

This can be used by BLACS workers and by the lyse API to enable saving
acquisition metadata and analysis results that are more complex datatypes.

This is motivated by [labscript devices pull request #71](#!/labscript_suite/labscript_devices/pull-requests/71)
which is a camera device that would like to save nested dictionaries as
attributes.

Minor version bump so other code can rely on this.

Since the serialisation is only done if the data does not map to a native HDF5 datatype,  use of these functions is completely backward compatible.

Add two new functions get_attributes and set_attributes, for getting and setting attributes with the automatic JSON serialisation/deserialisation on arbitrary HDF5 groups, not just device groups. This is basically just exposing the same functionality as t

This can be used by BLACS workers and by the lyse API to enable saving acquisition metadata and analysis results that are more complex datatypes.

This is motivated by labscript devices pull request #71 which is a camera device that would like to save nested dictionaries as attributes.

Minor version bump so other code can rely on this.

Since the serialisation is only done if the data does not map to a native HDF5 datatype, use of these functions is completely backward compatible.

title.raw: Add functions for JSON serialisation of attributes on arbitrary groups
